q: What is the difference between cyclical annealing and linear annealing in terms of their approach?
a: Cyclical annealing alternates between two states, while linear annealing increases progressively.

q: How does cyclical annealing maintain pattern diversity compared to linear annealing?
a: Cyclical annealing keeps the system oscillating and thus sustains high-level of pattern diversity; in contrast, linear annealing often leads to repetitive patterns due to monotonic progression.

q: What are two states that cyclical annealing alternates between?
a: Cyclical annealing switches back and forth between 0 (off or no constraint) and 1 (on or KL-constraint).

q: Why is linear annealing considered to cause premature collapse in some cases?
a: Due to its monotonic increase, it can quickly become overly constrained without maintaining the necessary diversity for continuous creativity.

q: In what context did cyclical annealing outperform other forms of AI learning algorithms according to the raw text provided?
a: Cyclical annealing showed superior performance in generating more musically coherent outputs while also maintaining high pattern diversity compared to linear and evolutionary approaches.
